sense.name: arrange or compress tigthly into a container
sense.commentary:
Syntax Is: NP1[agent] PACK (NP2[patient[concrete]]) (PP[goal]) Includes PACK TOGETHER, PACK UP, PACK IN.
NOTE: At least either NP2 or NP3 is required but both can be included. Compare to Sense 2: in Sense 1, objects are packed into a space by some outside agent(s). THIS SENSE INCLUDES THE 'MOVING' SENSE OF PACK_UP; SEE EXAMPLE 7.
sense.examples: Who Packed the Suitcase? Billy had carefully packed the maps. Taverns were called clubs and owners packed the cheese in crocks. The tighter a substance is packed, the denser it is. We packed the clay and straw into bricks. Heavy clouds packed together, signalling rain. I packed up my stuff and moved across town. This writer just packs in the metaphors, paragraph by paragraph.

sense.name: (cause to) congregate tightly in a area
sense.commentary:
Syntax Is: NP1[agent[animate]] PACK NP2[location]
Includes PACK TOGETHER
NOTE: Compare to Sense 1: in Sense 2 the objects are packing themselves together WITHOUT an outside agent.
sense.examples: Devotees packed the convention center for "Date With a Princess." A crowd of thousands packed the streets to celebrate this year's Onion Fayre. The huge crowd in Italy packed together and pushed toward a the fireworks show.

sense.name: carry a gun
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare carefully to sense 1. You cannot add a location to these sentences.
sense.examples: A robber who was packing a pellet gun lost out today to a motel guest packing a real firearm. You packing your gun? She's the kind of feisty woman who packs a gun for emergencies.

sense.name: set up a legislative body with one's own supporters
sense.examples: It is claimed that the sheriff packed the jury in the interest of appellees. The ruling party had packed the committee with loyalists.

sense.name: carry as a backpack, go backpacking
seal, insulate or protect
sense.examples: The best thing is to pack the faucet base with plumber's putty.

sense.name: have the property of compacting neatly
sense.examples: Live animals don't pack well. Silk shirts don't pack well, they get too wrinkled. Cups don't pack well and take up space. Snowshoe tails pack easily and can be attched quickly in the field.

sense.name: gain weight
sense.examples: Teenage tyrannosaurs packed on the pounds. 401(k) accounts have packed on some muscle. Bob has really been packing on the pounds lately.
